main event: Multiple objects were spotted visually and tracked on radar near Mescalero, New Mexico in 1955.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright silver specks moving from northwest to southeast across Apache Summit at various speeds.
Radar systems were able to pick up and track the objects, with the M-33 radar tracking between one to three targets at a time.
The objects were tracked on radar for about 45 minutes, with some targets climbing to an altitude of 25,000 feet and reaching speeds up to Mach 3.
No aircraft were reported in the area at the time of the sightings.
The radar data and visual sightings corroborated each other, but the objects could not be conclusively identified.
